author: chunqingchen
body:
**Repro:**
```powershell
New-PSSessionConfigurationFile -Path .\basicRRS.pssc -SessionType RestrictedRemoteServer -RunAsVirtualAccount
Register-PSSessionConfiguration -Name 'JEARepro' -Path .\basicRRS.pssc
Enter-PSSession . -ConfigurationName JEARepro
Get-Help Select-Object
```
**Expected behavior:**
Help content is returned for the "Select-Object" cmdlet

**Actual behavior:**
```
Cannot find path '' because it does not exist.
    + CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (:) [Get-Help], ItemNotFoundException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : PathNotFound,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.GetHelpCommand
```

comments.author: PaulHigin
comments.body: Can you please respond to me comment above?

comments.author: mirichmo
comments.body: @chunqingchen Please update this PR with tests per @SteveL-MSFT 's request

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
@chunqingchen Please use a meaningful title and description for the PR. The current title and description is suitable for an issue but not for a PR.
The guidelines are kept in [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request-submission) and I quote here:
>Add a meaningful title of the PR describing what change you want to check in. Don't simply put: "Fixes issue #5". A better example is: "Add Ensure parameter to New-Item cmdlet", with "Fixes #5" in the PR's body.
When you create a pull request, including a summary of what's included in your changes

comments.author: chunqingchen
comments.body: @iSazonov your comment has been resolved. thank you

comments.author: chunqingchen
comments.body: @daxian-dbw Hi, dongbo, can you help to merge? :)

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: @chunqingchen It looks new commits were pushed after the sign-off from @iSazonov and @PaulHigin. Please work with @mirichmo to see if further review is needed.

comments.author: chunqingchen
comments.body: @mirichmo @PaulHigin The additional change I made is set the test case as pending because our current test harness is not supporting Register-PSSessionConfiguration cmdlet and needs further work around. however it won't blocking the product fix. Paul, would you please confirm if you are good with this?

comments.author: mirichmo
comments.body: @PaulHigin Please take a look and provide an updated sign off since there were updates since the original sign off.

comments.author: mirichmo
comments.body: @chunqingchen This PR has been approved, but has merge conflicts. Please resolve them and push an update. I'll merge after that.

title: Get-Help does not work in JEA sessions
